candidates.title: fix: sdks
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added Merkle tree support with root reading capabilities and new validation constants.
  * Expanded public API exports for proof handling.
  * Added optional feature for merkle-tree functionality.

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Corrected file path formatting for program loading.

* **Chores**
  * Removed duplicate build configuration entries.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: refactor: libs to nostd
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Adds a lightweight event crate, read-only compressed-account variants, new CPI signer macros, a CpiSigner type, and optional SHA256/Keccak hashing support.

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Improved error messages, safer conditional logging for no_std builds, and explicit errors when crypto features are disabled.

* **Refactor**
  * Serialization and many traits gated by feature flags; wider no_std/alloc/std configurability and reduced default features for finer-grained builds.

* **Tests**
  * Expanded and reorganized tests for hashing, bigint conversions, zero-copy, and serialization; new no_std test harness.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: fix: prevent compressible account funding with 1 epoch
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **Bug Fixes**
  - New runtime guards and error responses for prefunding, initialization, delegate use, account counts, duplicate mints, and rent top‑up handling.

- **Documentation**
  - Updated guidance on prefunding rules, transfer padding/discriminators, compress-and-close validation, and rent/exemption examples.

- **Tests**
  - Major test reorganization: expanded integration suites (creation, ATA, transfer, compress/close, SPL compatibility), updated baselines and inputs, and removed/added several test modules.

- **Chores**
  - CI matrix/workflow added; public SDK/input sizes and rent-exemption constants adjusted.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: feat: add array map
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added a lightweight, no_std-compatible fixed-capacity array-backed map with key-based lookups and optimized support for 32-byte keys.
  * Added a method to access a public key's underlying 32-byte array.

* **Tests**
  * Added comprehensive tests for creation, insertion, retrieval, mutation, capacity limits, and last-updated tracking.

* **Chores**
  * Updated CI to run tests for the new map utility.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: refactor: feature gate poseidon
candidates.body:
Changes:
- light-poseidon increases compile time significantly
- light-sdk default `LightAccount` does not need `light-poseidon`
- add poseidon feature in `light-hasher` and use it in downstream crates

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Added optional Poseidon hashing support across SDKs and libraries (feature-flag gated); Poseidon-specific APIs available when enabled.

- Bug Fixes
  - Fixed program loader path used by test utilities.

- Tests
  - Enabled/gated Poseidon in numerous test suites and added Poseidon-specific tests.

- Chores
  - Removed CI steps that cached/downloaded proving keys.
  - Cleaned up dev-dependencies and adjusted build/task configuration formatting.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: refactor: light program test make anchor programs optional deps
candidates.body:
### Issue:
- light-compressed-accounts are currently incompatible with light-program-test because light-program-test has anchor program dependencies


<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Added read-only compressed account support (v2), including CPI read paths and guarded mutations with clearer errors.
  - Enhanced program-test: richer configuration, dev-env gating, account loading from JSON, and improved indexer/setup flows.
  - Expanded tests covering SHA256 and Poseidon read-only scenarios.

- Refactor
  - Simplified cryptographic/import paths and tightened public surface by removing unused conversions and re-scoping exports.

- Chores
  - Updated dependencies and feature flags; made several components optional; added base64 and serial_test; introduced program ID constants.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: feat: stateless js add pda helpers
candidates.body:
Changes:
- bumped anchor ts versions to 0.31.1
- add PackedAccounts to stateless js
- add v1 and v2 anchor ts client tests to v2 stateless js ci
- small fixes light-sdk

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - V2 support for creating, updating, and closing compressed accounts; new V2 APIs added to the program IDL.
  - RPC now exposes V2-style address tree info.
  - Utilities to simplify constructing instruction account metas.

- Improvements
  - Program-test logging now shows V1/V2-aware tree and queue public keys.

- Tests
  - End-to-end tests for V1 and V2 compressed account lifecycles; TypeScript-based test execution enabled and CI step added.

- Chores
  - Anchor/tooling versions and workspace config updated; installer versions adjusted; workspace expanded to include SDK tests.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: chore: add new rust release flow
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Automated release validation and publish workflows that run when PRs are labeled for release; integrated publish verification and release creation.

- **New Tools**
  - CLI helpers to create release pull requests, detect package version changes, and validate/publish crates.

- **Tests**
  - CI test matrix expanded; many tests now run unconditionally (feature gates removed).

- **Chores**
  - Multiple package version bumps and many internal crates marked non-publishable; removed legacy release automation.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: chore: bump pinocchio to v0.9
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- Chores
  - Updated core dependencies to newer versions for improved compatibility and future-proofing.

- Refactor
  - Reduced use of unsafe operations in system logging paths to enhance safety.

- Tests
  - Streamlined test setups by removing unnecessary cloning for faster, more reliable execution.
  - Added explicit panic capture in specific edge-case tests.
  - Adjusted test data initialization to better reflect intended validation scenarios.

- Documentation
  - No user-facing documentation changes.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: chore: update light sdk docs, upstream fixes
candidates.body:
Changes:
- add devnet batched Merkle trees to ts, rust client, light-program-test, and light test-validator
- fix comments
- rename `TokenAccount` -> `CompressedTokenAccount`

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Multiple V2 batched state trees/queues, network lookup-table pubkeys, a CPI signer-seed helper, relaxed boolean RPC inputs, and an ES/browser JS build.

- **Breaking Changes**
  - Indexer/client APIs now return compressed token-account variants instead of previous token-account types.

- **Improvements**
  - State-tree metadata now includes tree-type and address-assignment info; crate documentation wording refined.

- **Tests**
  - New V2 batched Merkle Tree tests and widespread test/init updates.

- **Chores / CI**
  - Simplified PR trigger syntax, updated test matrix, many account snapshot artifacts added, and installer/repo commit updates.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: chore: bump toolchain to 1.90
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Optional LiteSVM support for program-test; transaction sending reports Cancelled and Timeout outcomes.

- Improvements
  - Upgraded Solana workspace deps to 2.3 and Rust toolchain to 1.90.
  - RPC error handling extended to include LiteSVM; safer slice/iterator ergonomics and minor API lifetime clarifications.

- Tests
  - Updated test keypair construction and single-instruction handling; added lint allowances.

- Chores
  - Broad dependency and tooling updates with no user-visible behavior changes.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: chore: rename small_ix -> v2_ix
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Introduces V2 CPI mode across SDK and system program; enable via v2_ix feature.
- Refactor
  - Migrates all “Small/small_ix” flags, types, and helpers to “V2/v2_ix,” including AccountMode variant and CPI account/metadata builders.
  - Updates system account meta assembly to the V2 set (drops legacy NOOP entry).
  - Public APIs now accept/use v2_ix; consumers should update imports and parameters accordingly.
- Chores
  - Development environment default feature switched to v2_ix.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: feat: gnark14, forester
candidates.body:
forester: 
- switched from queue offsets to indices for cleaner queue handling
- fixed registration phase issues - forester now properly skips epochs it can't register for
- improved transaction processing with active phase checks
- cleaned up verbose logging (removed TPS metrics spam)
- added support for processing specific trees via CLI

gnark:
- gnark updated to 0.14
- gnark-crypto updated to 0.19
- updated formal verification from GatesGnark8 to GatesGnark12
- regenerated all proving and verifying keys for v0.14.0 compatibility
- prover code restructured, legacy circuits => v1, merkle circuits with PublicInputHash + batch circuits => v2
- fixed key generation and download scripts for new key format

candidates.title: chore: revert ctoken v2 hashing
candidates.body:
* **Revert TokenData hash fix**
  * To fix the issue that we currently mix up le and be serialization when hashing the TokenData amount we introduced correct amount serialization based on the tree discriminator. This fix is at odds with TokenData version based hashing in the Transfer2 instruction. 
  * Revert token data hashing selection based on tree discriminator.
  * This way we maintain flexibility for token data version based hashing in transfer2
* **Deactivate Cpi Context Features**
  * Added an optional feature to disable CPI-context usage, introducing a specific error when CPI-contexts are deactivated.



<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Added an optional feature to deactivate CPI context handling, returning a clear error when enabled.

- Refactor
  - Unified token hashing to a single deterministic path with little-endian amount encoding.
  - Simplified mint/transfer/burn/freeze/delegation flows by removing reliance on auxiliary account lists and discriminator-based branching.

- Bug Fixes
  - Introduced a specific system error code for the deactivated CPI-context case.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: refactor: sdk tests
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Increased supported data size for account creation and updates, enabling significantly larger payloads.
  - Added runtime logging for improved visibility during execution.

- Tests
  - Updated tests to use the new data size.
  - Broadened test coverage by removing a restrictive compile gate.
  - Added test automation script to run the tokenized test suite.

- Chores
  - Reorganized workspace paths for test modules.
  - Added/aligned workspace dependency for a shared zero-copy utility and JS test dependencies.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: feat: zero copy derive enum
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Derive macros now support enums and emit corresponding zero-copy enum types; fixed-size structs may use a unit-config alias.

* **Refactor**
  * Zero-copy APIs unified under trait-based interfaces and a config-driven model; docs updated for Borsh-compatible zero-copy usage.

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Size/capacity math now uses saturating arithmetic; new error variants surface allocation/overflow issues.

* **Behavior Changes**
  * Several sizing/initialization methods are fallible (Result); vector extend reports capacity errors instead of panicking.

* **Tests**
  * Large UI/pass/fail test suite added; some legacy unit tests removed.

* **Chores**
  * CI/lint adds no_std compatibility checks.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: feat: zero copy macro
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Introduced the `light-zero-copy-derive` procedural macro crate, enabling automatic zero-copy deserialization, mutable deserialization, and equality comparisons for Rust structs.
  * Added support for zero-copy mutable initialization with configuration-driven sizing and construction.
  * Expanded zero-copy deserialization to support signed integers, arrays, and complex nested types.

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Improved deserialization logic to validate buffer sizes before allocation, preventing potential heap exhaustion attacks.

* **Documentation**
  * Added comprehensive README and usage examples for the new derive crate.
  * Updated ignore patterns and removed outdated test instructions from documentation.

* **Tests**
  * Added extensive test suites covering zero-copy derive macros, mutable initialization, conversion, and randomized round-trip scenarios.

* **Chores**
  * Updated workspace and dependency configurations to include the new derive crate and related features.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: refactor: light-sdks detach account metas from account infos
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Introduced new public constants for account authorities and discriminators.
  * Expanded error handling with new error types and more descriptive error messages.

* **Refactor**
  * Improved account validation by making account constructors fallible and enforcing stricter checks.
  * Updated account metadata construction for more explicit configuration and improved clarity.
  * Enhanced error propagation and validation throughout account creation and CPI logic.

* **Chores**
  * Added a new dependency to support additional functionality.

* **Style**
  * Minor updates to trait bounds and import statements for improved code clarity.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: fix: zeroed root issue
candidates.body:
### Issue
- `light-client` photon indexer hardcodes root to `[0u8;32]`


### Bump versions
  - light-client: 0.13.0 → 0.13.1


<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Improved proof validation in tests by comparing returned proofs against locally constructed reference proofs, ensuring greater accuracy of Merkle and validity proof checks.
  - Corrected the handling of Merkle proof root values to accurately reflect API responses instead of using default values.

- **Chores**
  - Updated dependencies and package versions to maintain compatibility and stability.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
